newsitem.title: UK: C&W silent on talk it ending German alliance.
newsitem.headline: C&W silent on talk it ending German alliance.

text.p: UK telecommunications group Cable and Wireless Plc (C&W) declined to comment on Monday on newspaper reports that it plans to abandon its alliance with German utilities Veba AG and RWE AG.
"We do not comment on rumours and speculation," media relations manager Peter Eustace said.
Veba and C&W formed a strategic alliance in 1995 and last year agreed to bring RWE on board. Final contracts have been drawn up but C&W has so far declined to sign them.
The Times newspaper said on Monday that C&W had told its German partners it wanted to leave the alliance.

The report follows comments from an RWE official who told Reuters on Saturday that C&W has been exploring the possibility of an alliance with one of its main competitors, the Global One venture of Deutsche Telekom, France Telecom and Sprint Corp.
The TImes said C&W was becoming increasingly concerned about the rising costs of competing with Deutsche Telekom.
